rand-althor.name: Rand al'Thor
aliases: He Who Comes With the Dawn

1.description: Rules from the Stone of Tear as the Dragon Reborn. Struggles with leadership and the weight of prophecy.

24.description: Enters the twisted doorway ter'angreal in Rhuidean, experiencing visions of Aiel history and his own lineage.

26.description: Learns he is of Aiel blood, descendant of Aiel who served the Aes Sedai in the Age of Legends.

57.description: Recognized as Car'a'carn by the Aiel, the prophesied chief of chiefs who will unite all clans.

1.description: Reluctantly stays in the Stone of Tear. His ancient memories make him an exceptional battle commander.

24.description: Enters the twisted doorway in Rhuidean, gaining gifts and knowledge from the Aelfinn and Eelfinn.

29.description: Returns to the Two Rivers to find it under attack by Trollocs and Whitecloaks. Becomes a reluctant leader.

40.description: Accepts leadership role in defending the Two Rivers. His wolf abilities become more pronounced.

29.description: Accompanies Perrin to the Two Rivers. Her noble upbringing helps in organizing the defense.

11.description: Training with the Wise Ones in the Waste. Learning Aiel customs and developing her abilities.

20.description: Develops strong friendships with Aviendha and learns about Aiel culture and ji'e'toh.

11.description: Travels to Tanchico with Elayne to hunt Black Ajah and search for ter'angreal.
Partners with Nynaeve in hunting Black Ajah in Tanchico. Her royal training proves valuable.

1.description: Assigned by Wise Ones to guard and teach Rand about Aiel ways. Hostile but bound by duty.

20.description: Develops friendship with Egwene. Reveals she can channel but was trained as a Maiden instead.

1.description: Clan chief supporting Rand as He Who Comes With the Dawn. Wise and experienced leader.

11.description: Wise One of the Taardad Aiel, one of Rhuarc's wives. Powerful dreamwalker and teacher.
Ancient Wise One who cannot channel but is a powerful dreamwalker. Very wise and respected.
Young Wise One with fiery red hair and temper. Can channel and dreamwalk.
Wise One who helps train Egwene in Aiel customs and the use of the One Power.
Clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel. One of the chiefs following He Who Comes With the Dawn.

relationships.Allegiance: He Who Comes With the Dawn

11.description: Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel. Another supporter of the Dragon Reborn's claim.
Clan chief of the Chareen Aiel. Follows the prophesied Car'a'carn.
Clan chief of the Nakai Aiel. Respected leader among the Aiel clans.
Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel. One of the chiefs accepting Rand's leadership.
Shaido clan warrior who opposes Rand's claim as He Who Comes With the Dawn. Arrogant and ambitious.

28.description: Claims the title of Car'a'carn for himself using fake dragon marks. Leads the Shaido in rebellion.

22.description: Shaido warrior who enters Rhuidean alongside Rand. Couladin's brother and rival claimant.

26.description: Dies in Rhuidean, unable to complete the test that reveals Aiel history and purpose.

29.description: Accompanies Perrin to the Two Rivers. His Aiel warrior skills prove invaluable in the defense.
Maiden warrior helping defend the Two Rivers. Her spear skills are unmatched.
Maiden warrior from a different clan than Bain, but bound as first-sisters. Expert fighter.
Helps organize the Two Rivers defense. His military experience proves crucial in training farmers.
Mat's father, helps lead the Two Rivers defense. Skilled with a bow and experienced fighter.
Perrin's father, a blacksmith who helps arm the Two Rivers defenders. Proud of his son's leadership.
Village blacksmith who works tirelessly to arm the Two Rivers defenders. Former master to Perrin.
Master Luhhan's wife, helps organize the women's efforts in the Two Rivers defense.
Mayor of Emond's Field, works with Perrin to coordinate the village's defense efforts.
Egwene's mother and innkeeper, provides shelter and support during the Two Rivers crisis.
Leader of the Women's Circle, helps organize the civilian defense and support efforts.
Young man from the Two Rivers who joins the defense. Becomes one of Perrin's trusted fighters.
Two Rivers man who helps in the defense. Father to Tell and Dannil.
Young fighter in the Two Rivers defense. Son of Ban Crawe.
Two Rivers defender, brother to Tell. Becomes one of Perrin's reliable fighters.

33.description: Appears in the Two Rivers calling himself Ordeith. Manipulates the Whitecloaks into attacking.
Lord Captain of the Whitecloaks attacking the Two Rivers. Seeks vengeance for his father's death.
Fanatical Whitecloak who serves under Dain Bornhald. Convinced Perrin is a Darkfriend.

1.description: Continues to guide Rand while dealing with the complexities of ruling from the Stone of Tear.
Serves as Rand's sword instructor and bodyguard while bound to Moiraine as her Warder.

11.description: Accompanies Nynaeve and Elayne to Tanchico. His knowledge of politics and the Game of Houses proves invaluable.

1.description: Tairen High Lord serving under Rand. Vain and ambitious, but competent in his own way.
High Lord of Tear who must adapt to serving under the Dragon Reborn's rule.

11.description: Thief-catcher who aids Nynaeve and Elayne in Tanchico. His skills prove essential in navigating the city.

25.description: One of the Forsaken, master of Tel'aran'rhiod. Operates from shadows and prefers subtle manipulation.

54.description: One of the Forsaken, captured by Rand and forced to teach him to channel. Former Age of Legends musician.

relationships.Past: Musician of the Age of Legends

25.description: One of the Forsaken who has taken control of Andor by manipulating Queen Morgase through Compulsion.
Queen of Andor, under the influence of Rahvin's Compulsion. Her will has been subverted by the Forsaken.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

29.description: Travels with Perrin to the Two Rivers. His Ogier strength and loyalty make him invaluable in defense.

recaps.1: Rand rules uncomfortably from the Stone of Tear while Aiel gather in the city, causing tension with the Tairen nobility.
recaps.2: Political tensions rise in Tear as the High Lords struggle to accept Aiel presence and Rand's authority.
recaps.3: Bubbles of evil continue to manifest around Rand, showing the Dark One's growing influence on the Pattern.
recaps.4: Rand struggles with dreams of the past and visions of possible futures as his power and responsibilities grow.
recaps.5: The Aiel begin sharing their customs and beliefs with Rand, though many mysteries remain about their culture.
recaps.6: Moiraine attempts to guide Rand politically while the Stone becomes a center of prophecy and power.
recaps.7: Various factions position themselves around the Dragon Reborn as news of his identity spreads across nations.
recaps.8: Rand's relationship with the Aiel deepens as he learns more about their honor code and warrior traditions.
recaps.9: Political machinations intensify as various rulers and powers react to the Dragon Reborn's emergence.
recaps.10: The Aiel reveal more of their prophecies about He Who Comes With the Dawn, matching their beliefs to Rand.
recaps.11: Egwene travels to the Aiel Waste with the Wise Ones to learn about Aiel culture and her own growing abilities.
recaps.12: Nynaeve and Elayne journey to Tanchico following leads about Black Ajah and dangerous ter'angreal.
recaps.13: The hunt for Black Ajah intensifies as the sisters discover plots involving powerful artifacts and prophecies.
recaps.14: In Tanchico, political chaos erupts as various factions fight for control of the declining Panarch's empire.
recaps.15: Egwene's training with the Wise Ones reveals the depth of Aiel wisdom and their connection to dreams.
recaps.16: The search in Tanchico becomes dangerous as Black Ajah members work to retrieve powerful ter'angreal.
recaps.17: Rand prepares to travel to Rhuidean in the Aiel Waste to learn the truth about Aiel history and prophecy.
recaps.18: Political tensions continue to build as the Dragon Reborn's actions affect kingdoms across the continent.
recaps.19: The journey to the Aiel Waste begins, with various groups traveling toward their separate destinations.
recaps.20: Egwene and Aviendha develop their friendship while learning about each other's cultures and abilities.
recaps.21: In Tanchico, the investigation into Black Ajah activities reveals a web of conspiracy and dangerous plots.
recaps.22: Rand and Mat arrive in Rhuidean, the forbidden city where only clan chiefs and Wise Ones may enter safely.
recaps.23: The ancient city of Rhuidean holds mysteries and tests that will determine the fate of those who enter.
recaps.24: Mat and Rand enter ter'angreal that show different aspects of history and possible futures.
recaps.25: Moghedien, the Spider, begins weaving her web of plans involving the World of Dreams and ancient artifacts.
recaps.26: Rand experiences visions of Aiel history through his ancestors' eyes, learning their true origins and purpose.
recaps.27: The visions reveal the Aiel's past as the Da'shain Aiel, peaceful servants of Aes Sedai in the Age of Legends.
recaps.28: Couladin emerges from Rhuidean claiming to be the Car'a'carn, though his marks are false.
recaps.29: Perrin returns to the Two Rivers to find his homeland under attack by Trollocs and occupied by Whitecloaks.
recaps.30: The Two Rivers faces a crisis as Shadowspawn attack while Children of the Light claim to protect the region.
recaps.31: Perrin must overcome his reluctance to lead in order to organize an effective defense of his people.
recaps.32: The defense of Emond's Field begins as farmers and craftsmen are trained to fight Shadowspawn.
recaps.33: Padan Fain appears as 'Ordeith,' manipulating the Whitecloaks into attacking the very people they claim to protect.
recaps.34: Battles rage across the Two Rivers as multiple threats converge on the peaceful farming communities.
recaps.35: The Two Rivers folk show unexpected courage and determination in defending their homes against overwhelming odds.
recaps.36: Perrin's leadership grows stronger as he accepts responsibility for protecting his people and homeland.
recaps.37: The siege of Emond's Field intensifies as Trollocs mass for a final assault on the village defenses.
recaps.38: Desperate measures are taken to hold the defenses as the enemy forces seem overwhelming.
recaps.39: Hope arrives as unexpected allies appear to aid in the defense of the Two Rivers communities.
recaps.40: The tide of battle begins to turn as the Two Rivers defenders find new strength and tactical advantages.
recaps.41: Victory in the Two Rivers comes at a cost, but the homeland is saved from Shadow and Whitecloak occupation.
recaps.42: The aftermath of the battles reveals changes in both the land and the people who defended it.
recaps.43: Political ramifications of the Two Rivers conflicts spread as news reaches other kingdoms and rulers.
recaps.44: The Two Rivers begins to recover and rebuild, forever changed by the trials of war and leadership.
recaps.45: Perrin's reputation as a leader spreads beyond the Two Rivers, attracting both allies and enemies.
recaps.46: The consequences of the battles affect relationships and power structures throughout the region.
recaps.47: New alliances form as the success of the Two Rivers defense inspires others facing similar threats.
recaps.48: The changing political landscape reflects the broader transformation occurring across the continent.
recaps.49: Preparations begin for future challenges as the Two Rivers establishes its new place in the world.
recaps.50: The defense's success becomes a symbol of resistance against both Shadow and oppression.
recaps.51: Stories of the Two Rivers battles spread, inspiring hope and fear in equal measure among different factions.
recaps.52: The transformed Two Rivers begins to play a larger role in continental politics and prophecy.
recaps.53: New responsibilities and relationships emerge from the crucible of battle and leadership.
recaps.54: Asmodean is captured by Rand and forced to become his teacher in the use of saidin and the One Power.
recaps.55: The consequences of having a Forsaken as an unwilling teacher create new dangers and opportunities.
recaps.56: Political and personal relationships shift as the various storylines begin to converge toward future conflicts.
recaps.57: Rand is acknowledged as Car'a'carn by the Aiel clans, though the Shaido under Couladin remain in rebellion.
recaps.58: The stage is set for greater conflicts as the Dragon Reborn's growing power attracts both followers and enemies.
